verses.verse: I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> Go <S%H3212><s%> to now, <S%H4994><s%> I will prove <S%H5254><s%> you with mirth, <S%H8057><s%> therefore enjoy <S%H7200><s%> pleasure: <S%H2896><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> this <S%H1931><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>
I said <S%H559><s%> of laughter, <S%H7814><s%> It is mad: <S%H1984><s%> and of mirth, <S%H8057><s%> What <S%H4100><s%> does <S%H6213><s%> it?

I sought <S%H8446><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> to give <S%H4900><s%> myself to wine, <S%H3196><s%> yet acquainting <S%H5090><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> with wisdom; <S%H2451><s%> and to lay hold <S%H270><s%> on folly, <S%H5531><s%> till <S%H5704><s%> I might see <S%H7200><s%> what <S%H335><s%> was that good <S%H2896><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men, <S%H120><s%> which <S%H834><s%> they should do <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the heaven <S%H8064><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of their life. <S%H2416><s%>
I made me great <S%H1431><s%> works; <S%H4639><s%> I built <S%H1129><s%> me houses; <S%H1004><s%> I planted <S%H5193><s%> me vineyards: <S%H3754><s%>
I made <S%H6213><s%> me gardens <S%H1593><s%> and orchards, <S%H6508><s%> and I planted <S%H5193><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%> in them of all <S%H3605><s%> kind of fruits: <S%H6529><s%>
I made <S%H6213><s%> me pools <S%H1295><s%> of water, <S%H4325><s%> to water <S%H8248><s%> therewith the wood <S%H3293><s%> that brings <S%H6779><s%> forth <S%H6779><s%> trees: <S%H6086><s%>

I got <S%H7069><s%> me servants <S%H5650><s%> and maidens, <S%H8198><s%> and had <S%H1961><s%> servants born <S%H1121><s%> in my house; <S%H1004><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> I had <S%H1961><s%> great <S%H7235><s%> possessions <S%H4735><s%> of great <S%H1241><s%> and small cattle <S%H4735><s%> above all <S%H3605><s%> that were in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> me:

I gathered <S%H3664><s%> me also <S%H1571><s%> silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold, <S%H2091><s%> and the peculiar <S%H5459><s%> treasure of kings <S%H4428><s%> and of the provinces: <S%H4082><s%> I got <S%H6213><s%> me men singers <S%H7891><s%> and women singers, <S%H7891><s%> and the delights <S%H8588><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men, <S%H120><s%> as musical <S%H7705><s%> instruments, and that of all sorts.

So I was great, <S%H1431><s%> and increased <S%H3254><s%> more than all <S%H3605><s%> that were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem: <S%H3389><s%> also <S%H637><s%> my wisdom <S%H2451><s%> remained <S%H5975><s%> with me.

And whatever <S%H3605><s%> <S%H834><s%> my eyes <S%H5869><s%> desired <S%H7592><s%> I kept <S%H680><s%> not from them, I withheld <S%H4513><s%> not my heart <S%H3820><s%> from any <S%H3605><s%> joy; <S%H8057><s%> for my heart <S%H3820><s%> rejoiced <S%H8055><s%> in all <S%H3605><s%> my labor: <S%H5999><s%> and this <S%H2088><s%> was my portion <S%H2506><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> my labor. <S%H5999><s%>

Then I looked <S%H6437><s%> on all <S%H3605><s%> the works <S%H4639><s%> that my hands <S%H3027><s%> had worked, <S%H6213><s%> and on the labor <S%H5999><s%> that I had labored <S%H5998><s%> to do: <S%H6213><s%> and, behold, <S%H2009><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> was vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit, <S%H7307><s%> and there was no <S%H369><s%> profit <S%H3504><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

And I turned <S%H6437><s%> myself to behold <S%H7200><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and madness, <S%H1947><s%> and folly: <S%H5531><s%> for what <S%H4100><s%> can the man <S%H120><s%> do that comes after <S%H310><s%> the king? <S%H4428><s%> even <S%H853><s%> that which <S%H834><s%> has been already <S%H3528><s%> done. <S%H6213><s%>
Then I saw <S%H7200><s%> that wisdom <S%H2451><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> folly, <S%H5531><s%> as far as light <S%H216><s%> excels <S%H3504><s%> darkness. <S%H2822><s%>

The wise <S%H2450><s%> man's eyes <S%H5869><s%> are in his head; <S%H7218><s%> but the fool <S%H3684><s%> walks <S%H1980><s%> in darkness: <S%H2822><s%> and I myself <S%H589><s%> perceived <S%H3045><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> that one <S%H259><s%> event <S%H4745><s%> happens <S%H7136><s%> to them all. <S%H3605><s%>

Then said <S%H559><s%> I in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> As it happens <S%H4745><s%> to the fool, <S%H3684><s%> so it happens <S%H7136><s%> even <S%H1571><s%> to me; and why <S%H4100><s%> was I then <S%H227><s%> more <S%H3148><s%> wise? <S%H2449><s%> Then I said <S%H1696><s%> in my heart, <S%H3820><s%> that this <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

For there is no <S%H369><s%> remembrance <S%H2146><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%> more <S%H5973><s%> than <S%H5973><s%> of the fool <S%H3684><s%> for ever; <S%H5769><s%> seeing that which now <S%H3528><s%> is in the days <S%H3117><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> shall all <S%H3605><s%> be forgotten. <S%H7911><s%> And how <S%H349><s%> dies <S%H4191><s%> the wise <S%H2450><s%> man? as the fool. <S%H3684><s%>

Therefore I hated <S%H8130><s%> life; <S%H2416><s%> because <S%H3588><s%> the work <S%H4639><s%> that is worked <S%H6213><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun <S%H8121><s%> is grievous <S%H7451><s%> to me: for all <S%H3605><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit. <S%H7307><s%>

Yes, I hated <S%H8130><s%> all <S%H3605><s%> my labor <S%H5999><s%> which I had taken <S%H6001><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun: <S%H8121><s%> because I should leave <S%H5117><s%> it to the man <S%H120><s%> that shall be after <S%H310><s%> me.

And who <S%H4310><s%> knows <S%H3045><s%> whether he shall be a wise <S%H2450><s%> man or <S%H176><s%> a fool? <S%H5530><s%> yet shall he have rule <S%H7980><s%> over all <S%H3605><s%> my labor <S%H5999><s%> wherein I have labored, <S%H5998><s%> and wherein I have showed myself wise <S%H2449><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> is also <S%H1571><s%> vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

Therefore I went <S%H5437><s%> about <S%H5437><s%> to cause my heart <S%H3820><s%> to despair <S%H2976><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> the labor <S%H5999><s%> which I took under <S%H8478><s%> the sun. <S%H8121><s%>

For there is a man <S%H120><s%> whose labor <S%H5999><s%> is in wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and in knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> and in equity; <S%H3788><s%> yet to a man <S%H120><s%> that has not labored <S%H5998><s%> therein shall he leave <S%H5414><s%> it for his portion. <S%H2506><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a great <S%H7227><s%> evil. <S%H7451><s%>

For what <S%H4100><s%> has <S%H1933><s%> man <S%H120><s%> of all <S%H3605><s%> his labor, <S%H5999><s%> and of the vexation <S%H7475><s%> of his heart, <S%H3820><s%> wherein he has labored <S%H6001><s%> under <S%H8478><s%> the sun? <S%H8121><s%>

For all <S%H3605><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%> are sorrows, <S%H4341><s%> and his travail <S%H6045><s%> grief; <S%H3708><s%> yes, <S%H1571><s%> his heart <S%H3820><s%> takes not rest in the night. <S%H3915><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> <S%H1931><s%> is also <S%H1571><s%> vanity. <S%H1892><s%>

There is nothing <S%H369><s%> better <S%H2896><s%> for a man, <S%H120><s%> than that he should eat <S%H398><s%> and drink, <S%H8354><s%> and that he should make his soul <S%H5315><s%> enjoy <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> in his labor. <S%H5999><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> I saw, <S%H7200><s%> that it was from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God. <S%H430><s%>
For who <S%H4310><s%> can eat, <S%H398><s%> or who <S%H4310><s%> else can hasten <S%H2363><s%> hereunto, more <S%H2351><s%> than I?

For God gives <S%H5414><s%> to a man <S%H120><s%> that is good <S%H2896><s%> in his sight <S%H6440><s%> wisdom, <S%H2451><s%> and knowledge, <S%H1847><s%> and joy: <S%H8057><s%> but to the sinner <S%H2398><s%> he gives <S%H5414><s%> travail, <S%H6045><s%> to gather <S%H622><s%> and to heap <S%H3664><s%> up, that he may give <S%H5414><s%> to him that is good <S%H2896><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> God. <S%H430><s%> This <S%H2088><s%> also <S%H1571><s%> is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and vexation <S%H7469><s%> of spirit. <S%H7307><s%>
